definition: to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)

sentences.english: But, the princess suffers everybody to show tender affection for survival came down however.
sentences.chinese: 但是，公主卻受衆人愛憐倖存下來了。

sentences.english: It explored the self-love with which human beings are born.
sentences.chinese: 論文探討了人類與生俱來的自我愛憐之態。

sentences.english: She watched him with love and pity.
It is more show on the tender affection, even down a bit.
sentences.chinese: 而更顯露出對屈斯坦的愛憐，甚至有那麼點放縱。

sentences.english: Her grandmother always calls her "tiny thing" affectionately.
sentences.chinese: 奶奶總是愛憐地稱她爲“小東西”。

sentences.english: His eyes were full of love and expectation.
sentences.chinese: 他的眼中充滿着愛憐和期待。

sentences.english: Tolerance is love sick with the sickness of haughtiness.
sentences.chinese: 容忍對病泱泱的居傲充滿了愛憐與疼愛。

sentences.english: Tenderness, pity, regret, as after a pause he proceeded.
sentences.chinese: 溫柔，愛憐，惋惜，他頓了頓繼續說道。

definition: (of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
bridal room and ornamented candles/wedding festivities (idiom)
(of a girl) to feign anger coquettishly
